nl.inl.blacklab.search.indexmetadata

Class AnnotatedFieldNameUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.indexmetadata.AnnotatedFieldNameUtil

  • public final class AnnotatedFieldNameUtil
extends Object
    Some utility functions for dealing with annotated field names.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnnotatedFieldNameUtil.BookkeepFieldType 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String FORWARD_INDEX_ID_BOOKKEEP_NAME 
      static String LEMMA_ANNOT_NAME
      Annotation name for lemma/headword (optional, not every input format will have this)
      static String PUNCTUATION_ANNOT_NAME
      Annotation name for the spaces and punctuation between words
      static String SUBANNOTATION_FIELD_PREFIX_SEPARATOR
      Subannotations are indexed in a separate field, prefixed with their main annotation name, so a subannotation of "pos" named "number" will be indexed in a field "pos_number".
      static String SUBANNOTATION_SEPARATOR
      For annotations combined in a single Lucene field (the old way of indexing subannotations), this was the separator between the name prefix of an indexed value and the actual value of the annotation
      static String TAGS_ANNOT_NAME 
      static String WORD_ANNOT_NAME

      • SUBANNOTATION_FIELD_PREFIX_SEPARATOR

        public static final String SUBANNOTATION_FIELD_PREFIX_SEPARATOR
        Subannotations are indexed in a separate field, prefixed with their main annotation name, so a subannotation of "pos" named "number" will be indexed in a field "pos_number". This is the separator used for this prefix.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUBANNOTATION_SEPARATOR

        public static final String SUBANNOTATION_SEPARATOR
        For annotations combined in a single Lucene field (the old way of indexing subannotations), this was the separator between the name prefix of an indexed value and the actual value of the annotation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static String lengthTokensField(String fieldName)

        public static String tagAnnotationField(String fieldName)

      • annotationField

        public static String annotationField(String fieldName,
                                     String annotName,
                                     String sensitivityName)
        Construct (partial) Lucene field name for annotation on annotated field.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name, or null to leave this part out
        annotName - the annotation name (required)
        sensitivityName - the sensitivity name, or null to leave this part out
        Returns:
        the (partial) Lucene field name

      • annotationField

        public static String annotationField(String fieldName,
                                     String annotName)
        Construct partial Lucene field name for annotation on annotated field. Sensitivity part is not included.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the base field name, or null to leave this part out
        annotName - the annotation name (required)
        Returns:
        the partial Lucene field name

      • annotationSensitivity

        public static String annotationSensitivity(String fieldAnnotName,
                                           String sensitivityName)
        Construct a annotation alternative name from a field annotation name
        Parameters:
        fieldAnnotName - the field annotation name
        sensitivityName - the alternative name
        Returns:
        the field annotation alternative name

      • getNameComponents

        public static String[] getNameComponents(String luceneFieldName)
        Gets the different components of a annotated field annotation (alternative) name.
        Parameters:
        luceneFieldName - the Lucene index field name, with possibly a annotation and/or alternative added
        Returns:
        an array of size 1-4, containing the field name, and optionally the annotation name, alternative name and bookkeeping field name. Annotation name may be null if this is a main bookkeeping field. Alternative name may be null if this is a bookkeeping field or if it indicates the main annotation (not an alternative).

      • getBaseName

        public static String getBaseName(String luceneFieldName)
        Gets the base annotated field name from a Lucene index field name. So "contents" and "contents%pos" would both yield "contents".
        Parameters:
        luceneFieldName - the Lucene index field name, with possibly a annotation added
        Returns:
        the base annotated field name

      • getDefaultMainAnnotationName

        public static String getDefaultMainAnnotationName()

      • sensitivity

        public static MatchSensitivity sensitivity(String luceneField)

      • isAnnotatedField

        public static boolean isAnnotatedField(String luceneFieldName)
        Is the Lucene field name part of an annotated field or not?
        Parameters:
        luceneFieldName - the field name
        Returns:
        true if it's part of an annotated field, false if not

      • isValidXmlElementName

        public static boolean isValidXmlElementName(String name)
        Is the specified name a valid XML element name? Generally, field and annotation names should be valid XML element names, so we don't have to sanitize them when generating output XML.
        Parameters:
        name - name to check
        Returns:
        true iff it's a valid XML element name

      • sanitizeXmlElementName

        public static String sanitizeXmlElementName(String name)
        Sanitize name if necessary, replacing characters forbidden in XML element names with an underscore.
        Parameters:
        name - name to sanitize
        replaceChar - what to replace illegal characters with
        Returns:
        sanitized name

      • sanitizeXmlElementName

        public static String sanitizeXmlElementName(String name,
                                            String replaceChar)
        Sanitize name if necessary, replacing characters forbidden in XML element names. Also prepends an underscore if the name start in an invalid way (with the letters "xml" or not with letter or underscore).
        Parameters:
        name - name to sanitize
        replaceChar - what to replace illegal characters with (used as regex replace string)
        Returns:
        sanitized name
